MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Irish Manuscripts Commission.

Speaker.P: asked the President whether he will ascertain from the Irish Manuscripts Commission what steps that body has taken, or intends to take, to trace, examine, and (when found desirable) to publish documents of literary, historical and general interest in private ownership, other than the legal documents mentioned in the last paragraph of the introduction to the first volume of “Analecta Hibernica.”
I am having the enquiry referred to the Commission, and I will communicate their reply to the Deputy.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Dáil Loan Subscription.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Finance whether he will state when the subscription of £3 paid by Patrick Burke, of Kilcommodan, Aughrim, Ballinasloe, Co. Galway, to the Dáil Loan, 1919-20, will be refunded.

The application of Mr. Patrick Burke, of Kilcommedan, was not received until after the expiration of the time limit for making applications fixed by me in accordance with Section 4 (1) of the Dáil Eireann Loans and Funds Act, 1924, and I regret, therefore, that I am not in a position to authorise repayment.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Acton Estate (Co. Mayo).

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Lands and Fisheries if he will state the cause of delay in dividing the remainder of the lands of G. H. Acton Estate, Bridgemount, Belcarra, Castlebar, which were acquired by the Irish Land Commission over two years ago.

The Land Commission had hoped to be in a position to put the scheme for the division of these lands into operation last spring, but owing to the time unavoidably occupied in settling questions which arose in connection with the arrangements for division it was found impracticable to do so. The lands have been placed in charge of a stock manager with the object of providing for local grazing requirements pending the completion of the allotment proceedings.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Reclamation Schemes in Donegal.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Lands and Fisheries if he will state whether the Land Commission proposes to undertake in other districts in Co. Donegal any schemes of reclamation similar to that successfully carried out on the Rose O'Donnell Estate; and if he will give particulars of such schemes as have recently been sanctioned or are contemplated during the course of the present financial year.

Further reclamation proceedings in County Donegal during the present year will be mainly in the nature of small demonstration plots on which a variety of crops will be cultivated with a view to encouraging individual effort towards reclamation on the part of local occupiers of suitable land. Demonstration reclamation plots of about three acres each are being established on the Hill Estate, the Harper-Nixon Estate, the Peebles and Knox Estate, and the Conyngham (Rosses) Estate, all situate in the north-west area of County Donegal, which it is hoped will encourage the reclamation by the holders themselves of areas of undeveloped land in the neighbourhood.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Flooding of Donegal Farms.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Lands and Fisheries if his Department has made any investigation into the damage caused by blowing sand in certain areas of County Donegal, notably in the vicinity of Horn Head; and whether it is intended to take any steps to reduce the flooding of farm lands thus occasioned and to prevent the recurrence of similar damage.

The Land Commission has had under consideration the general question of damage to agricultural land consequent on accumulation of drifting sand along the western seaboard, and has been in communication with the Department of Agriculture on the matter. The subject is one of extraordinary difficulty, and anything that may be done must seemingly be largely in the nature of an experiment.

The position in the particular area to which the Deputy refers has been investigated. Proceedings for the purchase of untenanted lands in the vicinity of Horn Head are under consideration, and if and when these lands are acquired the Land Commission will consider whether anything can be done to deal with the blowing sand menace and consequent flooding of land at that place.
